fields_of_interest: Education and training, Research and innovation
organisation_name: European Quality Assurance Register for Higher Education (EQAR)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership: Federation of European and International Associations established in Belgium (FAIB)
relevant_communication:
EQAR has carried out a project on the Recognition of International Quality Assurance Activity in the European Higher Education Area (RIQAA). The aim of the project was to promote current and future opportunities for internationalisation of quality assurance practices and procedures, as well as to inform public authorities, quality assurance agencies (QAAs), higher education institutions (HEIs) and other key stakeholders. The project has been selected for an grant award by the Erasmus Programme under the Lifelong Learning Programme Call for Proposals Call EAC/S07/12 (2012/C 232/04) Selection Year 2013. 
 
EQAR has also been was selected for a EU co-funding in 2017 for an ERASMUS+ (Key Action 3) project titled Database of External Quality Assurance Results (DEQAR). EQAR along with its project partners (28 QA agencies, European stakeholder organisations i.e. ENQA, ESU, EUA, EURASHE, Education International and one ENIC-NARIC centre and the Ghent University) will be carryied out for a period of two years.  
 
Once set up, the Database will allow users to identify whether a higher education institution or its programmes have been subjected to external quality assurance in line with the ESG, by an EQAR-registered agency. The database would also provide users with easy access the corresponding quality assurance reports.
